betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oFeeling scientific?§r

This quest will explain a mechanic of the Assembly Line: §dResearch§r.

Recipes in the assembly line will often require Research. This means you need to do a few extra things before the recipe will run. You'll notice there's a second tab in §3JEI§r: §dThe Scanner§r. Recipes needing Research will also have the output show in the Scanner's page.

§9Scanning§r:

Scanning is the first step for research. Take the item shown in JEI and put it with a §3Data Stick§r to scan it. This will §4consume§r the item and put Data on the Data Stick. Pretty straightforward, right?

You will need at least an §6HV Scanner§r to progress to §dLuV§r, an §5EV Scanner§r for §aLuV Energy Hatches§r, and an §1IV Scanner§r for §aFusion Reactors§r. You can make any one of them to complete this quest.

See the next quest for how to use these §3Data Sticks§r.

§9Data Manipulation§r:

Eventually, you'll want multiple Assembly Lines, but you won't want to re-scan for every Research. This is why you can also use the §3Scanner§r to §dCopy Data§r. Place the data stick you want to copy in one slot, and a blank one in the other. This will copy the contents of the first stick into the second!

§4Important§r: Using two different data sticks with data on them will cause one to §4overwrite§r the other. Be careful!

§9Data Storage§r:

Later on, recipes will require different §aData Storage Items§r for research, such as the §3Data Orb§r. This process will remain the same, but will use different Data Storage Items instead. They can also be copied the same way, but you cannot copy between different types of storage items.

§eConfigs§r: If you find this mechanic unfun, it can be disabled with the config §5"B:enableResearch"§r. We strongly encourage you to try it out before disabling it right away, since it becomes very significant late game content as you progress further into research.

§bLore§r: In GT5, Assembly Line recipes would be hidden in NEI until you completed research for them. After scanning the data stick, you could view the recipe's ingredients by printing a book with the Data Stick - a long and annoying process! It was then made to display in NEI once you acquire the item.
TecTech later made a nice machine which acts as a recipe viewer for the Data Stick (this mod is so great...).
